author: Kenneth R. Rosen
title: China's New COVID-19 Hotspot on Russian Border Raises Tensions Between Two Allies
description: At least 346 Chinese nationals who travelled from Moscow through Suifenhe contracted the disease, turning the town into a point of strain for the "strategic partnership."
content: The machines lay idle at the mill in Suifenhe, the Chinese border city roughly 75 miles from the Russian port city of Vladivostok. Without the machines the workers cut, stack and sort the wood by hand, continuing work in a region that felt it had remained lar… [+3244 chars]
